intro: Pancheria ouaiemensis, commonly known as the Ouaiemensis pancheria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and full sunlight. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
